section.title: Vehicle features and options
section.paragraph: This chapter describes model-specific equipment, systems and functions that are available now and will be available in the future, even if they are not available in the owned vehicle.
Additional information:
Vehicle equipment.

section.title: Principle
section.paragraph: The vehicle apps can be used to display information on the control display, for instance, the weather or news.

section.title: Functional requirement
section.paragraph: A ConnectedDrive account must be created with BMW to display personal data.
Additional information:
BMW ID/driver profiles.

action-step.paragraph: Select desired app.
If necessary, view details.

section.title: Principle
section.paragraph: BMW provides mobility-based services and applications in an app.

section.title: General information
section.paragraph: The BMW app is available for iOS from the Apple App Store and for Android from the Google Play Store. The app must be downloaded and installed on the smartphone. The installation process depends on the smartphone that is used and the installed software.
When starting the app, a one-time registration is required provided no ConnectedDrive account with a BMW ID has been created yet.
The vehicle must be linked to the BMW ID in order to use the functions; you only need to do this once. The link is established with the app. Confirmation in the vehicle via iDrive is also required.
Some functions, e.g., BMW Remote Services, enable communication with the vehicle without the need for you to be inside or at the vehicle.
You can find the download and additional information on the app in the corresponding app store at http://b.mw/mybmwapp.
You can also call up the link to the app store by scanning the QR code.

section.title: Principle
section.paragraph: Third-party apps approved by BMW can be used depending on the country. The third party provider is responsible for the content and scope of the available apps.

section.title: General information
section.paragraph: For reasons of safety, some apps are usable only while the vehicle is stationary.
Information on use:

item.paragraph: It may not be possible to use the functions of the selected app in the vehicle and on the smartphone at the same time.
The use of third-party apps can incur costs. These costs are borne by the user of the respective app.

section.paragraph: Contact an authorized service center or another qualified service center or repair shop for more detailed information.

section.title: Functional requirement
section.paragraph: An account with the provider may be necessary to use the app.

action-step.paragraph: Select desired app.
Tap the desired function.

section.title: Accepting addresses as destinations
section.paragraph: Depending on the app, an address can be transferred to the BMW navigation system as a destination.

action-step.paragraph: Select the desired address.
Transfer the selected address to the BMW navigation system.
Correct entries, if necessary.
Confirm destination to start the navigation.

section.title: Exiting apps
section.paragraph: Tap the icon on the control display. The external app is exited.

section.title: Principle
section.paragraph: CarPlay allows select functions of a compatible Apple iPhone to be used via Siri voice control and iDrive.

section.title: General information
section.paragraph: Depending on the country-specific version, CarPlay may not be available. Contact an authorized service center or another qualified service center or repair shop for more detailed information.
The iPhone provides CarPlay and any associated apps. The scope and content depend on the device or software version and can vary depending on the national-market version.
Using Apple CarPlay can incur mobile service costs. The user must bear these costs.
Apple, the Apple logo, Apple TV, iPad, iPhone, iPod touch, iTunes and Mac are trademarks of Apple Inc., Cupertino, Calif., U.S.A.

section.title: Functional requirements

item.paragraph: Compatible iPhone, iPhone 5 or later with iOS 7.1 or later.
Appropriate mobile network contract for telephone and data services.
Bluetooth, Wi-Fi, and Siri voice control are activated on the iPhone.
If necessary, the setting for mobile data must be activated on the iPhone.
The iPhone is connected to the vehicle.
CarPlay has been selected as the connection mode.
Wi-Fi and Bluetooth are enabled in the vehicle.
No smartphone is connected to Android Auto.

section.paragraph: Additional information:
Compatible devices.
Vehicle Wi-Fi.
Bluetooth connection.

section.title: Pairing the iPhone with CarPlay

action-step.paragraph: Start Bluetooth® connection.
Select CarPlay as the connection mode:

section.paragraph: Additional information:
Bluetooth connection.

section.title: Selecting CarPlay
section.paragraph: CarPlay can be selected via different menus:
Via the main menu:
Tap the icon in the lower area of the menu bar on the control display.
Via the media menu:

action-step.paragraph: The iPhone music app opens.

section.paragraph: Via the communication menu:

action-step.paragraph: The iPhone telephone app opens.

section.title: Using CarPlay
section.paragraph: CarPlay can be used via iDrive and voice operation.
Via voice operation:

action-step.paragraph: Press and hold the button on the steering wheel until the Siri voice control is activated on the iPhone.
Say the same commands as if using the iPhone directly.

section.paragraph: Additional information:
Operation via Control Display and Controller.

section.title: Switching between CarPlay and iDrive
section.paragraph: To operate other functions via iDrive, CarPlay must be exited.
Tap the icon on the control display.
iDrive is displayed, CarPlay remains active in the background and can be selected again at any time.

section.title: Turning CarPlay on/off
section.paragraph: To use the iPhone without CarPlay, CarPlay must be switched off.

action-step.paragraph: For the desired iPhone, select CarPlay and switch on/off.

section.title: Transferring destination
section.paragraph: A destination from Apple Maps can be transferred to the BMW navigation system. This requires that the destination guidance in CarPlay has not been started.

action-step.paragraph: Press the button on the Controller.
The available navigation applications are displayed.
Select the BMW navigation system as the navigation application. Guidance is started and carried out with the selected system.

section.title: System limits
section.paragraph: The following restrictions apply to an iPhone connected via CarPlay:

item.paragraph: Not every app installed on the iPhone can be used via CarPlay.
Calling is only possible via CarPlay.
The phone book entries are not transferred into the vehicle.

section.title: Frequently Asked Questions
section.paragraph: All prerequisites are met and all required steps were completed in the specified order. Despite that, the mobile device does not function as expected.
In this case, the following explanations can help:
The iPhone has already been paired with Apple CarPlay. When a new connection is set up, CarPlay can no longer be selected.

item.paragraph: Change the connection type of the already connected device, for instance using as telephone.
Delete the iPhone concerned from the device list.
On the iPhone, delete the vehicle concerned from the list of stored connections under Bluetooth and under WLAN.
Pair the iPhone as a new device.

section.paragraph: If the desired function is still not carried out after the measures listed have been performed: contact Customer Relations, an authorized service center or another qualified service center or repair shop.

section.title: Principle
section.paragraph: Android Auto allows select functions of a compatible smartphone to be operated via Google Assistant voice control and via iDrive.

section.title: General information
section.paragraph: Depending on the national-market version, Android Auto may not be available. Contact an authorized service center or another qualified service center or repair shop for more detailed information.
The smartphone provides Android Auto and any associated apps. The scope and content depend on the equipment manufacturer and can vary depending on the national-market version.
Using Android Auto can incur wireless service fees. The user of the respective app must bear these costs.
Android Auto is a registered trademark of Google LLC.

section.title: Functional requirements

item.paragraph: The smartphone meets the prerequisite for a wireless Android Auto connection.
Compatible Android smartphone: Samsung or Google smartphone with Android 10 or an Android smartphone with Android 11, regardless of the manufacturer.
Appropriate mobile network contract for telephone and data services.
Bluetooth®, Wi-Fi and Google Assistant voice control are turned on the smartphone.
If necessary, the setting for mobile data must be activated on the smartphone.
The smartphone must support a Wi-Fi connection with 5 GHz.
Wi-Fi and Bluetooth are enabled in the vehicle.
No smartphone is connected to Apple CarPlay.

section.paragraph: Additional information:
Compatible devices.
Vehicle Wi-Fi.
Bluetooth connection.

section.title: Pairing a smartphone with Android Auto

action-step.paragraph: Start Bluetooth® connection.
Select Android Auto as the connection mode:

section.paragraph: Additional information:
Bluetooth connection.

section.title: Selecting Android Auto
section.paragraph: Android Auto can be selected from different menus.
Via the main menu:
Tap the icon in the lower area of the menu bar on the control display.
Via the media menu:

action-step.paragraph: The Music app of the smartphone opens.

section.paragraph: Via the communication menu:

action-step.paragraph: The telephone app of the smartphone opens.

section.title: Operating Android Auto
section.paragraph: Android Auto can be used via iDrive and voice operation.
Via voice operation:

action-step.paragraph: Press and hold the button on the steering wheel until the Google voice control is activated on the smartphone.
Say the commands familiar from the smartphone.

section.paragraph: Additional information:
Operation via Control Display and Controller.

section.title: Switching between Android Auto and iDrive
section.paragraph: To operate other functions via iDrive, Android Auto must be exited.
Tap the icon on the control display. iDrive is displayed and Android Auto remains active in the background and can be selected again at any time.

section.title: Turning Android Auto on/off
section.paragraph: To use the smartphone without Android Auto, Android Auto must be switched off.

action-step.paragraph: Switch Android Auto on/off for the desired smartphone.

section.title: System limits
section.paragraph: The following restrictions apply to a smartphone connected via Android Auto:

item.paragraph: Not every app installed on the smartphone can be used via Android Auto.

In this case, the following explanations can help:

item.paragraph: Delete the smartphone concerned from the device list.

Pair the smartphone as a new device.
